intro: Conomorpha laxiflora var. longifolia, commonly known as the long-flowered conomorpha, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, wiry stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences with white to pale pink flowers that bloom in the summer months. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
